title: Sr. Startup Account Manager
description:
* Technology related sales or business development experience
* Ability to build and deliver against a plan for your territory which meets or exceeds revenue targets
* Good understanding of the Northern European startup ecosystem, the main stakeholders and trends


Trusted by more startups around the world, AWS makes the power of cloud computing accessible for all by giving founders everywhere access to the same technology that powers the world’s largest companies. With nearly 20 years of experience gained from supporting hundreds of thousands of startups that have come before, we help founders prove that their world-changing ideas are possible, at any stage of growth or level of funding. This is why more startups, and over 80% of unicorns, build on AWS.
  
  

As a Startup Account Manager, you will help support the growth of your startup customers, servicing their unique needs, engaging with Founders, CxOs, Board of Directors and VC influencers, and teaming with business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to help the execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies.
  
  

Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.
  
  

In this role, you will also establish Amazon Web Services as the key cloud technology provider across the companies you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Startups Customers. You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT, helping your customers to leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft.
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Ensure customer satisfaction and success
* Drive business growth and AWS adoption with a defined set of customers
* Create and execute against comprehensive, customer-centric account plans to meet or exceed your goals
* Facilitate long-term relationships from C-level to engineers
* Accelerate your business by working with internal stakeholders and leveraging external partners
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services and Amazon
* Represent AWS at conferences & marketing events
* Expect moderate travel


A day in the life
  
A typical day involves engaging with developers and the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to discuss strategies for scaling the business. Conversations with founders are a key aspect, focusing on assisting them in achieving their business goals. The team collaborates internally during daily syncs, where ideas are shared, and discussions revolve around driving new opportunities and mutual learning. Additionally, in the EMEA region, there is an emphasis on dedicating a day each month to focus on individual wellbeing.
  
  

About the team
  
Our mission is to enable and support startups from their inception by helping them maximize the value of AWS to accelerate their businesses and increase their potential for success. You will be part of a diverse team who are customer obsessed and result driven and enjoy operating in a fast-paced environment. We extensively collaborate and support each other, continuously learn, celebrate success and have fun along the way.
  
  

**ABOUT AWS:**  

Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

* Business level proficiency in a Nordic language (Swedish, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian, Icelandic)
* A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science
* Demonstrable experience selling cloud solutions
* Experience with working for, or selling to tech startup


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Junior Systemingenjör till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Har du tagit examen inom maskinteknik/elektroteknik och vill arbeta i en praktiskt roll? Saab Surveillance** **söker nu en nyexaminerad systemingenjör med intresse för integration och verifiering.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.**

**Att jobba som junior Systemingenjör på** **Saab Surveillance**


Till ett team på Saab söker vi nu en junior Systemverifieringsingenjör som tycker om mixen av att både arbeta teoretiskt men också praktiskt. Du kommer att arbeta i hela kedjan där teamet arbetar med system.  

  

Som systemverifieringsingenjör kommer du att samordna och hjälpa till med demonstrationer och utprovning av ytradarprodukter, vilket inkluderar planering av flyg- och skjutprov, analys och tolkning av testdata/resultat samt rekommendera förbättringsåtgärder. Du kommer att arbeta med projektledning, för att ställa förväntningar och möta tidsfrister. Rollen innefattar även nära samarbete med ingenjörsteam för att bygga lösningar för att tillgodose kundens behov.


Teamet som du kommer att vara del av integrerar och verifierar produkter, markbaserade såväl som sjöbaserade, tillhörande Product Unit Surface Radar Solutions i Göteborg samt hos våra kunder och/eller partners. Teamet stöder och underhåller system som finns i drift, samt demonstrerar våra produkters förmåga över hela världen.


Andra arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:

* Analysera krav och konstruktionsverifieringstester
* Utföra formell verifiering och godkännande test tillsammans med kunder
* Du utför också serviceaktiviteter hos kunder
* Felsökning, verifiering och system förståelse
* Stora delar av dina arbetsuppgifter är hands-on där du rör dig inom olika avdelningar inom Saab


Rollen är placerad i Göteborg men det kan förekomma resor inom tjänst.

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab Surveillance i Kallebäck med start efter sommaren. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.

  

**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en kandidat/masterexamen inom maskin eller elektroteknik
* Har ett intresse för problemlösning
* Som person är du nyfiken och serviceminded
* Du är målmedveten och tycker om att komma framåt i ditt arbete
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Har goda kunskaper i Linux och Python är meriterande


För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.

 **Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman på johanna.norman@nexergroup.com


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

  

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

  

**Om Saab**


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 19 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld. Saab är också ett möjligheternas företag. Ett företag där du som medarbetare får stort ansvar och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Men också ett företag som respekterar varje människas behov av ett liv utanför arbetet. Saab ser mångfald som en tillgång och ständigt lärande som en självklarhet. Tekniskt är de ledande inom många områden och en femtedel av våra intäkter går till forskning och utveckling.

title: Tech Lead / Rust Developer - Engagement
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 800+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're on the lookout for a Tech Lead / Rust developer to join our team and play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our low-level code and cloud infrastructure. As part of our dynamic Engagement team, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the customer journey post-purchase, ensuring that our clients receive the best possible experience with our products.
   

  

 You'll be working at the intersection of embedded systems and cloud computing, driving the design and development of software that facilitates seamless communication and data transfer between our devices and cloud-based applications. Collaborating closely with your colleagues, you'll define software requirements, craft design specifications, and lead the charge in Rust development within our organization.
   

  

 What sets this role apart is the opportunity to make a significant impact on our development processes and product offerings. You'll have the autonomy to set the framework for Rust development activities and provide guidance to fellow developers, empowering them to excel in their operational tasks.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design and develop embedded systems software using Rust and related tools, including pipelines, testing, and automation.
* Collaborate with other developers, including hardware engineers, software developers, and cloud engineers, to ensure seamless integration between different layers of the system.


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid background in software development, ideally acquired within a product-focused company or scale-up environment
* Commercial experience with Rust and Linux
* Understanding of how IoT and wireless devices can be connected


**Nice to have**
* Experience working with IoT, Bluetooth, and wireless devices
* Experience with Kotlin and Python
* Knowledge of databases (Redis, MongoDB)
* DevOps understanding; maintaining own code (AWS)
* MQTT experience


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Client Executive
description:
As our new Client Executive, you will be part of the continuous journey towards building a strong and professional Multinational team in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





 As a key member of the team, you will be tasked with servicing our Swedish book of clients.
 



  





 To succeed in this position, you must work with a high level of structure and a proactive approach to your tasks. We are a complex and dynamic organization, so you have to thrive in such an environment.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Daily advice to customers in all Non-Life Lines of Business as well as handling international insurance programs
* Analysis tasks, including analysis of policies, claims data and administration, business risks and due diligence;
* Preparation of renewal proposals and tender materials as well as comparison of insurance offers;
* Ensure the development of innovative best-practice solutions and know-how tools within the professional and business area



  





**Qualifications** 



* Education at minimum Bachelor level or
* Work experience from a similar position within the insurance or broker industry;
* Fluent in Swedish and English (oral and written)
* Experienced user of Microsoft Office tools, in particular Excel
* Flair for IT systems



  





 As a person, you have excellent interpersonal skills and are able to work within a team. You are analytical and structured in your way of working. You have a flexible and pro-active mindset and meet deadlines. 
 



  





 Do not hesitate in reaching out - with questions or application!

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO berlin Hybrid)
description:
**Job Title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)**
**Location:** 
 Germany
   

  

**Position Overview:** 
 The Chief Technology Officer (CTO) will play a pivotal role in shaping technology vision, driving product innovation, and scaling our business to new heights. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in VC funding, proven success in scaling businesses, and extensive experience in a startup environment. This is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic team and make a significant impact on the future of our company.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute the company’s technology strategy in alignment with business goals.
* Lead and manage the technology team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.
* Oversee all aspects of technology development, including architecture, engineering, and product management.
* Drive the successful scaling of our technology infrastructure to support rapid business growth.
* Identify and implement new technologies that enhance our product offerings and operational efficiency.
* Collaborate with the executive team to secure VC funding and manage investor relations.
* Ensure robust cybersecurity measures and data protection protocols are in place.
* Monitor technology trends and emerging technologies to stay ahead of the competition.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a CTO or in a similar senior technology leadership role.
* Successful track record of securing VC funding and managing investor relationships.
* Demonstrated ability to scale technology platforms in a high-growth startup environment.
* Strong technical background with expertise in [relevant technologies, programming languages, and tools
* Excellent leadership and team management skills with a focus on mentoring and developing talent.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to align technology initiatives with business objectives.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

title: Head of Enterprise Greenfield, Europe North, AWS
IT-arkitekt
description:
Du kommer ha en central, strategisk roll för organisationens övergripande IT-lösningar. Du designar, planerar och implementerar skalbara och säkra lösningar, anpassade efter verksamhetens behov.
 



  
 




  


**Din roll** 




 Vi söker en IT-arkitekt som vill vara med och forma framtidens IT-landskap. I denna roll kommer du att ansvara för att designa och utveckla hållbara och innovativa IT-arkitekturer som hjälper våra kunder mot mål. Du arbetar strategiskt och nära verksamheten för att säkerställa att IT-lösningar är både hållbara, säkra och skalbara.
   

  
 



**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Designa och utveckla IT-arkitekturer som stöder affärsmål och verksamhetskrav
* Analysera, bedöma och förbättra befintliga IT-system
* Samarbeta med utvecklings- och driftteam för att implementera arkitektoniska lösningar
* Utvärdera och välja teknologier som bäst passar organisationens behov
* Fungera som teknisk rådgivare och stödja ledningsgrupper i tekniska beslut
* Utveckla och underhålla arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer



**Kvalifikationer** 



* Flera års erfarenhet av arbete som IT-arkitekt eller i liknande roll
* Stark kunskap inom IT-infrastruktur, molnlösningar, nätverk och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera komplexa IT-system
* Förståelse för både on-premise- och molnarkitekturer
* Relevant utbildning och/eller certifieringar är meriterande
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska koncept på ett enkelt sätt för olika intressenter
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift







  





**💚 Human IT** 




 Human IT handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.
 



 I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.
 



 Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden 🚀
   

  
   




* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Kollektivavtal
* Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
* Utvecklingsplan
* Hälsoförsäkring + pension
* Förskottssemester



**Start** 
 : Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och när säkerhetskontroll är genomförd. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.
 



**Plats** 
 : Stockholm
 



**Ansökan** 
 : Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



*Human IT arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.* 




  





**Och förresten:** 




*Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Human IT’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Human IT anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.*

title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
**About the Role:** 




 Security Operations Engineers are responsible for security operations including managing security tools around malware protection, vulnerability management, log correlation and more. They maintain rulesets, operate the tools and are responsible for follow-up on findings. They will perform monitoring of security events in a SIEM-system and perform escalation to incidents and manage those.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Monitor vulnerabilities, overseeing the vulnerability scanning program and its follow-up
* Provide practical recommendations to address identified flaws, vulnerabilities, and misconfigurations to mitigate cyber risks effectively
* Security monitoring through alert investigations and threat hunting
* Be part of the incident response team
* Manage the endpoint protection and response solution and detection engineering
* Collaborate closely with IT staff in various business units
* Develop innovative solutions related to threat intelligence, vulnerability management, security monitoring, log correlation, and security metrics
* Stay updated with the latest developments in IT security, new threats, and vulnerabilities, continuously evolving the security strategy to address emerging challenges
* Be part of the cyber security team on-call rotation



  





**Key Skills and Qualifications:** 



* 5-8 years of relevant security operations experience, including working with SIEM tools, cyber threats mitigation, incident response, and IT forensic investigation
* Proficiency in security testing of networks, systems, and applications
* University or college degree in a relevant field
* Fluent in English
* Experience in Cybersecurity transformation involving multiple teams and stakeholders
* Good understanding of typical attacker tactics and techniques
* Strong knowledge of cybersecurity and associated technologies, including operating systems, cloud solutions, network technologies, and security tools
* Sense of responsibility with a curious and eager-to-learn mindset.
* Structured and organized approach to work
* Interest and ability to work across the entire IT-security lifecycle, from Assessment to Design, Implementation, and Maintenance
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team, with minimal supervision
* Security certifications are considered advantageous



  





  





**About OSTTRA** 




  





*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.* 




  





 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
 



 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
 



 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
 



  





 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
 



  





**What’s In It For You?**




  





**Benefits:**




 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
 



  





 Our benefits include:
 


* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.



 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
 



  





 -----------------------------------------------------------
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
 







 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to:
 
 EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com
 
 and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: Graduate Consultants for Cloud First at Accenture Technology
description:
*Are you ready to put your skills and abilities into practice? Come join Accenture in Stockholm, Malmö or Gothenburg in February or August 2025 and let us help you create the perfect foundation for a career within Technology consulting!*
 Tech Talent Program
   

  

 When entering Accenture Technology as a graduate consultant, you will be part of our Tech Talent Program.
   

  

  

- During the two-year Tech Talent Program, you will go through an intense learning process – with a Buddy and People Lead helping and coaching you to figure out exactly how to develop your career and skills needed to succeed.

- You will be a consultant from day one as you will be part of projects where we implement complex technology and business critical IT systems for our international clients, transforming their business.

- You will build your professional network across the organization by being part of projects, taking part in our communities and by joining our social events and parties.

 Accenture Technology Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital and security methodologies to help clients innovate, grow, and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs. Cloud First Accenture continues to lead in the cloud and today has a broad footprint among all the major cloud providers as well as private clouds and on-premise infrastructure. Digital and cloud technologies are changing the way our clients do business and are transforming the operating models and infrastructure at the heart of their operations. We have a clear market differentiation and leadership in New Emerging & Growth Technologies like Extended Reality, Blockchain, Application Security and leveraging our Innovation Architecture that will reflect the essence of the New Engineered Software Technologies
 **About the role**
 Whether you are a programmer guru, a digital innovator, a tech wizard, or a business problem solver, you will find an exciting career path on the cutting edge. We would love to get to know your unique blend of talents and help you explore and grow them further
   

  

*These are some of the responsibilities and tasks that you as a graduate may work with:*
- Help our customers to develop the best IT solutions by being a link between business and IT

- Work with cloud solutions like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Cloud Platform, Azure and Amazon Web Services

- Support in identifying customer requirements, seek client clarifications, understand compliance and apply modern cloud functionality to meet the requirements

- Work and develop solutions using program languages like Java, Python, SQL and more

- Design and build security in IT environments and cloud platforms

- Support in developing relevant solutions and requirements fitting well to our Journey to the Cloud strategy (J2C)

- Support in Change Management, help clients make best usage of the Accenture assets and best practices across the clouds

- Support project management or other management functions in projects

- Grow your professional skills within analytics, artificial intelligence, Big Data and machine learning

**Who are you?**
- You will soon receive your bachelor’s or master's degree within relevant area

- You want to join our Stockholm office in February or August 2025

- You have excellent written and oral presentation skills in both English and Swedish

- You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and motivated to start your career in a technology consulting role

**Application**
 Send your application and attach:
   

  

  

- CV

- Cover Letter (please specify which office(s) your are applying to as well as start in either February or August 2025)

- University transcripts/grades

 Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all these documents are required for a complete application.
 **Only complete applications are reviewed.** 
 Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after. Thank you for your interest in Accenture! If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability as well as a personality form.
   

  

**By joining Accenture, you get**
- An end-to-end focus with clients as a trusted partner and advisor to support them from strategy to execution

- Access to a global network of experts and personal co-operation with senior high-performing colleagues and market leading clients

- A career counselor/mentor who helps you define career goals and supports you in achieving your goals and your full potential

- Personal training opportunities and a market leading career-development program. Excellent possibilities for learning and knowledge gain, resulting in a great possibility to grow as both a person and a professional.

- A very strong team culture among supportive colleagues, where team spirit and cooperation are highly valued and rewarded

- Extensive wellbeing program, that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy, and ability to work in a sustainable way.

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks.

 We look forward to receiving your application! Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!
   

  

**What you also get** 
**:** 
 Accenture IF
   

  

 Accenture IF is a community hosted by our colleagues – for our colleagues, to meet and practice sports and physical activities. We offer a wide range of activities like football, racket sports, running, sailing, golf, yoga and much more.
   

  

 To exercise sports, you enjoy in the company of others, will help you stay motivated and healthy. Join our yearly events such as a cross-country skiing bootcamp, Accenture European Championship in football or an upcoming hiking trip in the mountains. We strongly believe in work-life balance and to have fun together! Parental leave
   

  

 We want our employees to grow and achieve value in life, both in their profession and in their personal life. Accenture offer a market leading compensation for parental leave – we pay for 270 days and compensate 90% of the difference between Social Insurance Agency’s (Försäkringskassan) maximum coverage and a base pay up to 80 000 SEK/month. Sick leave/Well-being
   

  

 In need of medical treatment, we want our employees to get well supported. All Accenture employees are covered by a health insurance by Skandia - Skandia Lifeline Access. The insurance offers healthcare of physical and mental treatments, including rehabilitation. During sick leave you will get well covered, Accenture pay 80% of your salary day 2-14 and 90% day 15-90. Our “Truly Human” network aim to bring us all together – as truly human individuals. We commit to care for ourselves and others, to foster an open-minded and supporting environment. Together we can help each other to achieve our aspirations and become the best version of ourselves. One of many initiatives are “Truly Human Health Academy”, a 100-day journey filled with classes held by health- and dietician experts, workshops, and buddy challenges – to learn and reflect on well-being and daily habits. Networks
   

  

 At Accenture we offer network opportunities, for our employees to meet and share common interests. Our aim is to foster a company culture that stands for inclusion and diversity – a place for everyone in terms of cross-cultural diversity, ethnicity, gender, disability, mental health, and LGBTQI.
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
   

  

 All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
   

  

 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

title: Integration Architect (APIs & event-driven architecture)
description:
**Job Description**
 We are accelerating digitalization and to stay relevant, we need to ensure we have experienced Integration Architect in place to bring our best capabilities, innovation ideas and talented technologists to support the transformation of H&M Group.
   

  

 Are you passionate about APIs and events architecture, designing composable solutions and evaluating innovative IT architecture then we’ve got a job for you.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to join the Integration Architecture team, you will play an integral part in defining the Integration Architecture throughout our organization. You will conduct thorough analysis of existing solutions, identify gaps, and recommend improvements, you will also define the strategy and best practices going forward, spread our knowledge and experience of how to design solutions that are reusable, discoverable, and composable.
   

  

 We offer rewarding challenges that encourages you to grow in your role and lets you collaborate with and learn from several domains within the organization.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Support the Product teams with API & Event architecture and ensure high-quality integration design.
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes.
* Lead and facilitate workshops to Support and enable teams in the organization to define and design capabilities and composable solutions.
* Identify opportunities for improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Provide necessary guidance, analysis and design tasks related to composable solutions, ensuring that solutions meet business needs and are aligned with architectural governance and patterns.
* Actively contribute to knowledge sharing and continuous improvement initiatives, both within our own team and with the rest of the organization
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog.
* Produce and maintain articles and documents for knowledge sharing.
* Plan and drive workshops with implementation teams, architects, and business stakeholders.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 5 years of experience of solution architecture
* 3+ years of experience of working with designing APIs.
* 3+ years of experience of working with event driven integrations.
* 3+ years of experience of designing complex, cloud-based solutions, ideally in Azure.
* Experience of planning and driving workshops with implementation teams, architects as well as business stakeholders
* Experience of working with enterprise architecture and process modellining
* Ability to communicate around and understand low level implementation details, as well as high level abstract concepts and business aspects.
* Ability to work with composability frameworks and support to define Packaged Business Capabilities (PBCs) to ensure scalable and modular architectural solutions.
* Experience from capability modeling is a big plus.
* Experience from working with Solace, Kafka, Azure APIM or Akamai
* Experience from GCP Integration Services is a plus.
* Merit of having certification in IT architecture


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **30th of November** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: IT Infrastructure Engineer
description:
At Tobii, we want to empower businesses and professionals with revolutionary insights into human behavior using the powers of eye tracking and attention computing. We are already making it, and we want to leverage further. We need people who are modern product thinkers, have an eye for technology, and beyond ready to amaze customers.
 



  





 Based at our HQ in Stockholm, you will play a key role as our new
 **IT Infrastructure Engineer** 
 , ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability of our network and server infrastructure. You will manage and maintain both physical and virtual IT environments, ensure seamless and secure connectivity across on-premises and cloud systems, and support our most critical IT operations.
 



  





 You will be the technical owner responsible for the design and architecture of the physical infrastructure (servers and networks), hybrid AD, and hybrid Exchange.
 



  





**Ready to take on this role? Here's what your day or week could look like:** 



* Drive, maintain, and develop global and local network infrastructure: oversee routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless networks, following security best practices
* Administer hybrid environments: handle Active Directory architecture, Microsoft Entra ID, Conditional Access policies, and MFA
* Oversee cloud and on-premises environments: manage public and private cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, VMware), maintain Windows and Linux servers, and monitor backups
* Maintain VPNs and firewall policies: manage IPSEC VPNs, Client VPN configurations, and firewall rules for remote locations and partners
* Ensure server and storage integrity: maintain on-premises servers and storage systems, including remote administration with Lights Out technology
* Manage network security: monitor IDS systems, handle alerts, and contribute to security policies and risk management
* Troubleshoot infrastructure issues: provide 2nd/3rd line ServiceDesk support and resolve network-related incidents
* Operate enterprise WiFi and wired networks: manage wired 802.1x and WiFi networks for reliable connectivity
* Supplier relationship management: set technical requirements for, and build and maintain relationships with suppliers



  





**To be successful in this role, we would love if you have:** 



* 5+ years of solid experience in network architecture and management
* Bachelor's degree in Network Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology
* Proven experience with enterprise-level network design and multi-site deployments
* Hands-on experience with network services and protocols (NPS, Radius, DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP)
* Expertise in configuring and managing switches, routers, firewalls, and VPNs
* Proficiency with network security and monitoring tools, including intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS)
* Experience with hybrid cloud networking and integration of on-premises networks with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, VMware)
* Excellent communication skills both in Swedish and English for collaborating effectively with diverse teams, including both technical and non-technical members
* A merit if you have related certifications (e.g., CCNA/CCNP, CompTIA Network+, VMware, Azure/AWS certifications)
* Driver's license would be preferred



  





**You are a person with:** 



* Strong analytical and problem solving skills to tackle complex network challenges and troubleshooting
* Independent and team-oriented mindset with a customer-focused approach
* Flexible and adaptable to changes, embracing new challenges
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively
* Willingness to learn and stay updated with evolving technologies, industry trends and advancements



  





**Sounds like you?** 




 We are curious about you! Let us know about your background, experiences and where you’re heading. Due to GDPR, we will only review those applications directed to our career page - so please submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through it!
 



  





**Tobii is the global leader in eye tracking** 




 A position we earned through our passion for technology and our ambition to create tech for a better future. Our journey began over 20 years ago when we delivered the world’s first plug-and-play eye tracker. Since then, we’ve been on a mission to build technology that understands human attention and intent.
 



  





 Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Tobii covers the global market with offices in Belgium, China, Germany, Ireland, Japan, Switzerland, Romania, Taiwan, the UK, and the US.

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
**Are you passionate about data and the business value it can create? Look no further - Data Edge is the place to be!** 




  





 Our ambition is to create a leading consulting company in the intersection between Business development, Analytics and Data. In order to succeed with that we need great people that want constant learning, are curious, have high integrity and love teamwork. Above all, share our passion about creating lasting business value through data and analysis.
 



  





 We who work at Data Edge have many years of experience in data, analysis and data-driven transformation from leading consulting and tech companies and know what is needed to realize business value through data. Our ambition is to be the given choice for organizations that need to bridge the gap between business and technology, from strategy to implementation.
 



  





 At Data Edge, we strive to live by our values: Passion for Data, Integrity, and Teamwork.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* The opportunity to be part of a team that is committed to developing within the field. We invest in our growth through initiatives such as internal knowledge sharing and participation in external seminars/events.
* A diverse range of challenges, both with clients and within our own company development. You will be instrumental in building a company where you will have significant impact and involvement.
* A clear niche and broad network that will ensure engaging and rewarding projects within the field.



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




  





 Below are some areas with concrete examples of the skills you need. The list does not cover all required skills, but it's impossible for one person to be an expert in everything.
 



  




* **Passion for Data and Analytics:** 
  You genuinely enjoy using data and analytics to solve real-world problems for our clients.
* **Business Understanding:** 
  You have a knack for understanding business problems, what drives business success, and have experience working in business development.
* **Experience:** 
  You have at least 3 years of employment as either a Data Scientist or a consultant in Data Science.
* **Analytical Skills:** 
  You have experience conducting a wide range of analyses of varying complexity across different industries and are eager to learn more.
* **Cloud Platforms:** 
  Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
* **Cloud Computing & Modern Engineering Practices:** 
  Knowledge of cloud computing and modern engineering practices (e.g., version control, CI/CD, and Docker).
* **Programming Skills:** 
  Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and experience in working with applied machine learning and generative AI.
* **Data Visualization & Communication:** 
 Ability to visualize complex data and clearly communicate insights to clients, making it actionable for business users.
* **Location & Eligibility:** 
  You are based in Stockholm and legally eligible to work in Sweden.
* **Interest in Building the Company:** 
  We also hope that you are interested in continuing to build Data Edge!



  





 If this sounds interesting to you, please reach out! In your application, we would love to hear about your strengths and how you fit the role, as well as areas where you’re looking to grow, given the above description. No one knows everything, but we constantly strive to develop our skills and remain humble about the breadth of expertise required to drive business value from data.

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
Position: Network Security Engineer
 



 Location: Södertälje, Sweden
 



 Job Type: Contract
 



  





 Job description:
 



  




* Experience in Fortinate SDWAN , Checkpoint Firewalls, Cloud Phone solution.
* Relevant experiences with F5 GTM, LTM, ASM and APM implementation
* Subject matter expertise (SME) with regard to architecture/engineering for new load balancer implementations, cloud environment integrations, project designs, and standards development
* Load balancing administration/support for intelligent DNS routing between enterprise locations/data centers, as well as plan and implement upgrades (includes installation of new equipment)
* Implement approved authentication and certificate management controls
* Configure self IPs, port lockdown, and network routes
* Troubleshoot, configure, upgrade, maintain, and monitor the load balancer network architecture (performance, configurations, traffic flow, application monitoring, CPU capacity/utilization) Analyze network alarms and identify sources
* Configuration of Virtual server through iApps
* Understanding of different load balancing algorithms
* Should be able to manage HA & Software Upgrades
* Required advanced skills of designing, coding, and troubleshooting iRules and iControls
* Able to configure & manage VPN profiles based on customer specific requirements
* Required understanding of the different load balancing options & features to include OneConnect, Persistence, SSL client / server profiles, HTTP profiles
* Partner with the information security personnel to assess potential exposure to vulnerabilities, identify mitigation plans, and ensure compliance with enterprise security baselines and standards
* Understanding on ASM so as to protect web application from external attacks
* Strong knowledge and troubleshooting experience on checkpoint Firewall
* Tufin knowledge will be added advantage
* Good experience on Pulse Secure VPN client
* IP Security (IPsec)
* Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS)
* Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP)
* Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP)
* Good hands-on & troubleshooting experience on settings & configuration of site to site & SSL VPN
* Upgrade for SSL VPN clients
* Good knowledge on VPN routing
* Split VPN Configuration
* Knowledge on Certificate renewals & licensing for VPN

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly capable Senior Infrastructure Engineer to help shape the future of our infrastructure. You will drive improvements across our products and services, ensuring quality, scalability, and reliability. In this role, you'll lead by example—writing and reviewing code, resolving technical challenges, and advancing automation practices. Whether you have deep experience in the field or are a strong engineer ready to take the next step, we're looking for individuals who are passionate about infrastructure, problem-solving, and innovation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the technical delivery of complex infrastructure projects, from initial planning to implementation.
* Maintain, scale, and enhance our infrastructure to meet evolving demands.
* Drive automation efforts, ensuring our systems are designed for flexibility and growth.
* Facilitate workshops and training to share best practices and upskill team members.
* Mentor and guide team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing environment.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and long-term technology strategies.
* Prioritize and manage backlogs, ensuring timely and effective project delivery.
* Support the Service Desk and second-line teams with prioritization and incident handling.
* Stay updated on compliance requirements and contribute to maintaining a secure, compliant infrastructure.
* Uphold the company's values, promoting a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration.
* Ensure adherence to company processes, procedures, and methodologies for consistent project execution.


**Skills And Qualifications**
* Proven experience with Virtualization and OpenStack technologies.
* Expertise in automation and orchestration tools and practices.
* Strong knowledge of large-scale production systems and the latest industry technologies.
* Ability to design and implement infrastructure solutions, with experience in both small and medium-scale systems.
* Solid programming and scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar languages).
* Problem-solving experience, ideally with open-source tools and solutions.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to mentor others and foster collaboration.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* A strategic mindset, with the ability to weigh cost and value in decision-making processes.


 If you have a solid foundation in infrastructure engineering and are excited about working on challenging projects, we encourage you to apply. This is an opportunity to make a significant impact while working in an environment that values growth, innovation, and teamwork.

title: Junior Communications Specialist
description:
Are you an ambitious and self-driven Junior Communications Specialist eager to gain hands-on experience across all areas of corporate communications? If so, this is an excellent opportunity to develop a broad skill set while being part of a fun and supportive team ! Join ASSA ABLOY’s Group Communications team in Stockholm, Sweden, where you’ll become part of a collaborative culture that supports you in building a meaningful and impactful career.
   

  

**What you would do as our** 
**Junior Communications Specialist**
 Your role involves content creation and coordination of a variety of communication projects such internal campaigns, digital townhalls, social media and more.
   

  

 You will be joining a tight-knit, experienced team of five who enjoy working and innovating together.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Create and edit digital media content like films , slideshows, presentations and infographics, using Adobe Creative Cloud.
* Publish content for the external web and social media.
* Prepare reports and summaries.
* Coordinate projects involving teams across our global organization, as well as supporting daily tasks within Group Communications.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Holds a degree in communications, marketing or a related field.
* 1–2 years of relevant work experience.
* Has a strong interest in hands-on digital communications, with proven skills in content creation.
* Possesses excellent English and communication skills (Swedish is a plus).
* Brings a creative, solutions-oriented mindset, pared with high energy and enthusiasm.


**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment in a hybrid model (minimum 3 days in the office).
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait:**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Product Manager - Security Solutions - Sweden
description:
**Senior Product Manager - Security Solutions** 




  





**Location:** 
 Copenhagen/Oslo/Stockholm
 



  





*Are you passionate about connecting people and leading product development by having ownership of your own products, ensuring the development of Security solutions and innovation? Do you thrive on the challenge of translating complex technological concepts into real-world solutions? If so, we have the perfect role for you!* 




  





 As a Senior Product Manager in our security solutions team, you'll be at the forefront of advancing the cybersecurity landscape. Your work will directly impact the safety and security of businesses in the Nordics, allowing them to operate with confidence in an ever-evolving digital environment.
 



  





**About Your Role And The Team** 




 As our Senior Product Manager, you will be a key driver behind our next-generation security solutions. You will be responsible for defining and executing a strategic product roadmap that aligns with our company's vision and market demands. By leveraging your deep understanding of cloud technologies and cybersecurity, you will develop innovative products that address pressing security challenges. Your ability to synthesize market research, customer feedback, and technological advancements will be critical in shaping our offerings and ensuring they deliver value to our customers.
 



  





**Here are some examples of key responsibilities during a typical day:** 



* Define and execute the product roadmap, aligning with strategic goals and market needs.
* Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, customer needs, and innovation opportunities.
* Collaborate closely with engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support teams to deliver high-quality products.
* Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and ensure product satisfaction.
* Monitor product performance and iterate based on feedback and market changes.



  





**WHY you should join us** 




 Joining our team means being part of a culture that values diversity, inclusion, and innovation. You'll have the opportunity to work with advanced technologies and collaborate with a talented, multidisciplinary team. We offer a flexible working environment that supports professional development and career growth. At GlobalConnect, we are committed to advancing cybersecurity through cloud technologies—if you're looking to make an impact in this exciting field, this is the place for you!
 



  





**Who We Are Looking For** 




 We are seeking an experienced product manager who has a technical background and a proven track record in the cybersecurity industry. You should be a strategic thinker, capable of managing complex projects and leading cross-functional teams. We value individuals who are customer-focused, driven by innovation, and excited to tackle challenging problems in the evolving field of cybersecurity.
 



  





**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:** 



* At least 7 years of product management experience, with a minimum of 3 years in a senior role within the cybersecurity industry.
* Strong understanding of cloud technologies and cybersecurity solutions, specifically with Microsoft Entra, Defender, Palo Alto Cortex, Fortinet, Versa, Cisco, and HPE Aruba.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills. Project management experience is a plus.
* Fluency in English and at least one Nordic language (Swedish, Norwegian or Danish).



  





 If you read the job ad and believe this sounds interesting, then we really look forward to hearing from you! And we look forward to reviewing your CV containing a short description of why you match this role.
 



  





**GlobalConnect** 
 is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Join us in our mission to advance cybersecurity through the cloud!

title: Sr. Startup Account Manager
description:
**Description**
 Trusted by more startups around the world, AWS makes the power of cloud computing accessible for all by giving founders everywhere access to the same technology that powers the world’s largest companies. With nearly 20 years of experience gained from supporting hundreds of thousands of startups that have come before, we help founders prove that their world-changing ideas are possible, at any stage of growth or level of funding. This is why more startups, and over 80% of unicorns, build on AWS.
   

  

 As a Startup Account Manager, you will help support the growth of your startup customers, servicing their unique needs, engaging with Founders, CxOs, Board of Directors and VC influencers, and teaming with business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to help the execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies.
   

  

 Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.
   

  

 In this role, you will also establish Amazon Web Services as the key cloud technology provider across the companies you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Startups Customers. You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT, helping your customers to leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Ensure customer satisfaction and success
* Drive business growth and AWS adoption with a defined set of customers
* Create and execute against comprehensive, customer-centric account plans to meet or exceed your goals
* Facilitate long-term relationships from C-level to engineers
* Accelerate your business by working with internal stakeholders and leveraging external partners
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services and Amazon
* Represent AWS at conferences & marketing events
* Expect moderate travel


 A day in the life
   

  

 A typical day involves engaging with developers and the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to discuss strategies for scaling the business. Conversations with founders are a key aspect, focusing on assisting them in achieving their business goals. The team collaborates internally during daily syncs, where ideas are shared, and discussions revolve around driving new opportunities and mutual learning. Additionally, in the EMEA region, there is an emphasis on dedicating a day each month to focus on individual wellbeing.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our mission is to enable and support startups from their inception by helping them maximize the value of AWS to accelerate their businesses and increase their potential for success. You will be part of a diverse team who are customer obsessed and result driven and enjoy operating in a fast-paced environment. We extensively collaborate and support each other, continuously learn, celebrate success and have fun along the way.
   

  

**About Aws**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Technology related sales or business development experience
* Ability to build and deliver against a plan for your territory which meets or exceeds revenue targets
* Good understanding of the Northern European startup ecosystem, the main stakeholders and trends


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Business level proficiency in a Nordic language (Swedish, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian, Icelandic)
* A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science
* Demonstrable experience selling cloud solutions
* Experience with working for, or selling to tech startup


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2822406

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job Description:**
 As a Data Engineer at Dentsu Data (DD) is a data and analytics consulting company with approximately 20 employees that serves as a Center of Excellence and delivers services to customers throughout Dentsu. We are now looking for someone who is passionate about developing integrated data systems. The assignment is both about creating solutions for the dentsu group and advising customers on the best solution for them and then assisting in the implementation.
   

  

 You will work together with the client teams across all dentsu agencies to support our clients' development in martech and data. The role involves a consultative role towards some of Sweden's largest companies and of course varies between different projects and customers. Our goal is to match consultants in the best way possible with assignments for development and innovation.
   

  

* Technical Expertise: Serve as the technically knowledgeable person in customer teams. Advise on the best data solutions in an educational manner.
* Implementation: Drive the implementation of data platforms. Develop solutions for data visualization.
* Consultation: Work consultatively with some of Sweden’s largest companies. Support clients’ development in martech and data.
* Collaboration: Collaborate with client teams across all Dentsu agencies. Match consultants with assignments for development and innovation.
* Data Systems Development: Develop integrated data systems for the Dentsu group and its customers. Assist in the implementation of these systems.
* Educational Role: Break down and present technical solutions to colleagues and customers based on their level of knowledge. Be the technically knowledgeable person in customer teams, who can take responsibility for and advise on the best solution in an educational way. Drive the implementation of data platforms and develop solutions for e.g. data visualization.


**Who are you:**
* General understanding of marketing, tech and data, interest in predictive analytics.
* Experience in programming in Python.
* Accustomed to SQL.
* Basic knowledge in the ETL (Extract Transform Load) process.
* Habit of data visualization in dashboards (Power BI).
* Data analysis/basic statistical competence.
* Experience/knowledge in Cloud (Google Cloud Platform & BigQuery, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or similar)
* Very good language skills in both Swedish and English.
* Experience with platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Salesforce, etc. is meritorious.


 As a person, you are a self-motivated problem solver with a good ability to prioritize between tasks and projects. You are curious and have an interest in new technical solutions and opportunities to automate and streamline. You like to work in teams and have a pedagogical ability to break down and present technical solutions to both colleagues and customers based on their level of knowledge. To thrive in the role, we believe that you have a clear business mindset and are used to working consultatively.
   

  

**ABOUT DD & Dentsu**
 Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data, known for holistic customer insights and intelligent use of data that drives better business decisions. DD consists of two business areas. Our Business Intelligence team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). Our Audience Intellligence team works with our clients on issues related to budgeting, competitor monitoring, market research and effectiveness studies, and audience insights. DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.
   

  

 DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings.
   

  

**Additional Information:**
* Collective agreements
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days holiday entitlement
* Flexibility and the best possible mix of two good things, working in our offices and working from home
* Great career and development opportunities


 The position is full-time permanent employment with a 6-month probation period, located at our Stockholm office. Interviews are conducted continuously, and the start date is as soon as possible/according to the agreement. We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact:**
 We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Dentsu Media
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Software Development Intern
description:
***This job is with Oracle, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
 Java is one of the most popular programming languages in the world and it runs on billions of devices scaling from credit cards to multi-machine servers. Oracle is the main contributor to the Java programming language, developed through the OpenJDK project. The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) is the core piece of technology that enables Java’s “write once, run anywhere” - the ability to run the same Java program on multiple hardware architectures and operating systems without having to recompile the code.
   

  

 The JVM also implements the Java memory management with Garbage Collectors (GCs) that handle all the details for you, and just-in-time (JIT) compilers that enable Java performance to be better than what is possible with any statically compiled language.We are now looking for talented, purpose-focused, and highly motivated collaborators for an internship in the Stockholm development office.
   

  

 The goal of this project is to achieve faster compilation times, more precise GC barrier elision opportunities, more maintainable and less fragile code, possibly even more efficient GC barrier implementations by going lower level than a CPU agnostic IR, and hopefully getting to a more standardized way of emitting GC barriers instead of all GCs doing different things as it is today.
   

  

 This will be achieved by building a GC barrier infrastructure for the G1 GC similar to what has already been done for Generational ZGC. GC barriers are machine code instructions used to help perform bookkeeping required to maintain invariants. This project involves injecting the machine instructions for GC barriers at the very late instruction emission phase of the C2 JIT compiler, instead of the very early bytecode parsing phase where it is emitted today.
   

  

 By emitting the GC barriers very early as done today, optimization phases throughout the compilers (e.g. escape analysis) currently needs to recognize that it should do something different for GC barrier Intermediate Representation (IR) nodes, as opposed to general application IR. The new approach doesn’t add any IR nodes for the GC barriers at all, and hence doesn’t introduce such complexity to the compiler design.The new feature should be implemented for the x64 and aarch64 CPU targets, likely to involve low level architecture specific optimization of the machine instruction sequences, as well as high level optimizations on the IR level to elide unnecessary GC barriers
   

  

**Requirements-**
 Good communication and presentation skills in English.- Experience in computer science fundamentals.- Experience with modern IDEs and version control (Git).- C++ programming skills and experience with assembly.- Good problem-solving skills.- Experience with the Java Virtual Machine (Specification) is a plus.- Garbage Collection and Compiler development expertise is a plus.
   

  

 Career Level - IC0
   

  

 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
